Rationale2: The health auto-configuration `AutoconfigureOrder` entry was referring to the standard couchbase auto-configuration that was not responsible for configuring the `CouchbaseOperations` bean, causing the health indicator implementation to rely on the presence of such a bean.
The maximum and minimum number of connections are not metrics so these are not exposed. Fix the doc that stated the contrary.
simplifying the auto-configuration and let it us proxy-free configuration classes

This commit ensures that a primary JSR 303 and `<iden>` will be exposed if the auto-configuration kicks in. As `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts (JSR-303 `<iden>` and `<iden>` as well as the `<iden>` validator one), this makes sure that those types can be injected by type. `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts and were only checking for the absence of a `javax.validation.<iden>` to auto-configure a `<iden>`. If no standard JSR validator exists but a <iden>s `<iden>` exists and is primary, we shouldnt flag the auto-configured one as `<iden>`. Previous iterations on this feature have made sure that well auto-configure at most one `javax.validation.<iden>` so not flagging it `<iden>` is no problem. This commit also restores and adds tests that validate `<file_name>` will configure a JSR validator even if a <iden> is present. This effectively fixes `<issue_link>` in a different way. Closes `<issue_link>` Closes `<issue_link>`

Decision2: Notify the use of logback specific system property
Rationale2: Users following the logback documentation can be confused at first so were not logging a warning when we found out that the logback specific property has been specified.

Test that <iden> works when thread is interrupted
Rationale2: Update RandomAccessDataFile to acquire the semaphore uninterruptibly to allow loading classes or resources on an interrupted thread
to fail fast with an information exception message when we detect that the embedded servlet container factory beans class cannot be instantiated

Decision2: Update view of bean types when an override is detected
Rationale2: Previously, when a bean was overridden and its type changes, \<file_name> could be left with a stale view of the beans type. This would lead to incorrect bean condition evaluation as conditions would match or not match based on the beans old type.

Decision2: Fix <file_name> handling of profiles activated by a file
Rationale2: Previously, <file_name> used a <iden> with no PathTransformer. This would result in an NPE within Maven, compounded by the NPE not being included in the failure message, hindering diagnosis. This commit updates <file_name> to configure its <iden> with a PathTransformer and improves the failure message for better problem diagnosis.

Improve diagnostics when <file_name> type deduction fails
Rationale2: previously, this failure was only logged as a debug message, leaving the user with a misleading message suggesting that the @ConditionalOnBean or <iden> annotation was not configured correctly.

Decision2: Clean up logging dependencies and exclusions
Fix broken links in the documentation
Honour ext and classifier on @Grabbed dependencies
Rationale2: We currently honour type, but ignore ext. <iden> doesnt make a distinction between the two so a Grab that specifies both type and ext but with different values is considered to be an error.
to make it work with `full` Maven profile.

Decision2: Blitz some more special characters from the metric names
Rationale2: When MVC path matchers are used as metric keys, they can still contain invalid characters and patterns (like asterisks). This change removes some more special characters and also tidies up the names a bit so no key part starts or ends with - (which is ugly)

Decision2: Add /error to ignored paths for security autoconfig
Rationale2: Protecting /error doesnt make a great deal of sense and if it is protected you dont get the ErrorPageFilter for the attempt at loading it, so Tomcat renders its own HTML error page

Rationale2: If profiles were activated via the environment using the active and include profile property, profiles specified via the active property would take precedence. This commit restores that behavior.

Decision1: The nested class should be public.
Rationale1: The nested private static class would cause an error at startup stating that it was not accessible when trying to bind the property from the environment.
Rationale2: This commit ensures that a primary JSR 303 and `<iden>` will be exposed if the auto-configuration kicks in. As `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts (JSR-303 `<iden>` and `<iden>` as well as the `<iden>` validator one), this makes sure that those types can be injected by type. `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts and were only checking for the absence of a `javax.validation.<iden>` to auto-configure a `<iden>`. If no standard JSR validator exists but a <iden>s `<iden>` exists and is primary, we shouldnt flag the auto-configured one as `<iden>`. Previous iterations on this feature have made sure that well auto-configure at most one `javax.validation.<iden>` so not flagging it `<iden>` is no problem. This commit also restores and adds tests that validate `<file_name>` will configure a JSR validator even if a <iden> is present. This effectively fixes `<issue_link>` in a different way. Closes `<issue_link>` Closes `<issue_link>`

Decision2: Update view of bean types when an override is detected

Decision2: Fix <file_name> handling of profiles activated by a file
Rationale2: Previously, <file_name> used a <iden> with no PathTransformer. This would result in an NPE within Maven, compounded by the NPE not being included in the failure message, hindering diagnosis. This commit updates <file_name> to configure its <iden> with a PathTransformer and improves the failure message for better problem diagnosis.

Decision1: Fix typos in the documentation: though -> through
Rationale2: This commit ensures that a primary JSR 303 and `<iden>` will be exposed if the auto-configuration kicks in. As `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts (JSR-303 `<iden>` and `<iden>` as well as the `<iden>` validator one), this makes sure that those types can be injected by type. `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts and were only checking for the absence of a `javax.validation.<iden>` to auto-configure a `<iden>`. If no standard JSR validator exists but a <iden>s `<iden>` exists and is primary, we shouldnt flag the auto-configured one as `<iden>`. Previous iterations on this feature have made sure that well auto-configure at most one `javax.validation.<iden>` so not flagging it `<iden>` is no problem. This commit also restores and adds tests that validate `<file_name>` will configure a JSR validator even if a <iden> is present. This effectively fixes `<issue_link>` in a different way. Closes `<issue_link>` Closes `<issue_link>`

If no standard JSR validator exists but a <iden>s `<iden>` exists and is primary, we shouldnt flag the auto-configured one as `<iden>`. Previous iterations on this feature have made sure that well auto-configure at most one `javax.validation.<iden>` so not flagging it `<iden>` is no problem. This commit also restores and adds tests that validate `<file_name>` will configure a JSR validator even if a <iden> is present. This effectively fixes `<issue_link>` in a different way. Closes `<issue_link>` Closes `<issue_link>`

Rationale2: This commit ensures that a primary JSR 303 and `<iden>` will be exposed if the auto-configuration kicks in. As `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts (JSR-303 `<iden>` and `<iden>` as well as the `<iden>` validator one), this makes sure that those types can be injected by type. `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts and were only checking for the absence of a `javax.validation.<iden>` to auto-configure a `<iden>`. If no standard JSR validator exists but a <iden>s `<iden>` exists and is primary, we shouldnt flag the auto-configured one as `<iden>`. Previous iterations on this feature have made sure that well auto-configure at most one `javax.validation.<iden>` so not flagging it `<iden>` is no problem. This commit also restores and adds tests that validate `<file_name>` will configure a JSR validator even if a <iden> is present. This effectively fixes `<issue_link>` in a different way. Closes `<issue_link>` Closes `<issue_link>`

Rationale2: This commit ensures that a primary JSR 303 and `<iden>` will be exposed if the auto-configuration kicks in. As `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts (JSR-303 `<iden>` and `<iden>` as well as the `<iden>` validator one), this makes sure that those types can be injected by type. `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts and were only checking for the absence of a `javax.validation.<iden>` to auto-configure a `<iden>`. If no standard JSR validator exists but a <iden>s `<iden>` exists and is primary, we shouldnt flag the auto-configured one as `<iden>`. Previous iterations on this feature have made sure that well auto-configure at most one `javax.validation.<iden>` so not flagging it `<iden>` is no problem. This commit also restores and adds tests that validate `<file_name>` will configure a JSR validator even if a <iden> is present. This effectively fixes `<issue_link>` in a different way. Closes `<issue_link>` Closes `<issue_link>`

Rationale2: This commit ensures that a primary JSR 303 and `<iden>` will be exposed if the auto-configuration kicks in. As `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts (JSR-303 `<iden>` and `<iden>` as well as the `<iden>` validator one), this makes sure that those types can be injected by type. `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts and were only checking for the absence of a `javax.validation.<iden>` to auto-configure a `<iden>`. If no standard JSR validator exists but a <iden>s `<iden>` exists and is primary, we shouldnt flag the auto-configured one as `<iden>`. Previous iterations on this feature have made sure that well auto-configure at most one `javax.validation.<iden>` so not flagging it `<iden>` is no problem. This commit also restores and adds tests that validate `<file_name>` will configure a JSR validator even if a <iden> is present. This effectively fixes `<issue_link>` in a different way. Closes `<issue_link>` Closes `<issue_link>`

Decision1: Update ` <file_name> ` so that the `<iden>` is not thrown for permission denied errors.
Rationale2: This commit ensures that a primary JSR 303 and `<iden>` will be exposed if the auto-configuration kicks in. As `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts (JSR-303 `<iden>` and `<iden>` as well as the `<iden>` validator one), this makes sure that those types can be injected by type. `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts and were only checking for the absence of a `javax.validation.<iden>` to auto-configure a `<iden>`. If no standard JSR validator exists but a <iden>s `<iden>` exists and is primary, we shouldnt flag the auto-configured one as `<iden>`. Previous iterations on this feature have made sure that well auto-configure at most one `javax.validation.<iden>` so not flagging it `<iden>` is no problem. This commit also restores and adds tests that validate `<file_name>` will configure a JSR validator even if a <iden> is present. This effectively fixes `<issue_link>` in a different way. Closes `<issue_link>` Closes `<issue_link>`

Rationale2: This commit ensures that a primary JSR 303 and `<iden>` will be exposed if the auto-configuration kicks in. As `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts (JSR-303 `<iden>` and `<iden>` as well as the `<iden>` validator one), this makes sure that those types can be injected by type. `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts and were only checking for the absence of a `javax.validation.<iden>` to auto-configure a `<iden>`. If no standard JSR validator exists but a <iden>s `<iden>` exists and is primary, we shouldnt flag the auto-configured one as `<iden>`. Previous iterations on this feature have made sure that well auto-configure at most one `javax.validation.<iden>` so not flagging it `<iden>` is no problem. This commit also restores and adds tests that validate `<file_name>` will configure a JSR validator even if a <iden> is present. This effectively fixes `<issue_link>` in a different way. Closes `<issue_link>` Closes `<issue_link>`

Rationale2: This commit ensures that a primary JSR 303 and `<iden>` will be exposed if the auto-configuration kicks in. As `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts (JSR-303 `<iden>` and `<iden>` as well as the `<iden>` validator one), this makes sure that those types can be injected by type. `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts and were only checking for the absence of a `javax.validation.<iden>` to auto-configure a `<iden>`. If no standard JSR validator exists but a <iden>s `<iden>` exists and is primary, we shouldnt flag the auto-configured one as `<iden>`. Previous iterations on this feature have made sure that well auto-configure at most one `javax.validation.<iden>` so not flagging it `<iden>` is no problem. This commit also restores and adds tests that validate `<file_name>` will configure a JSR validator even if a <iden> is present. This effectively fixes `<issue_link>` in a different way. Closes `<issue_link>` Closes `<issue_link>`

simplifying the auto-configuration and let it us proxy-free configuration classes

This commit ensures that a primary JSR 303 and `<iden>` will be exposed if the auto-configuration kicks in. As `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts (JSR-303 `<iden>` and `<iden>` as well as the `<iden>` validator one), this makes sure that those types can be injected by type. `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts and were only checking for the absence of a `javax.validation.<iden>` to auto-configure a `<iden>`. If no standard JSR validator exists but a <iden>s `<iden>` exists and is primary, we shouldnt flag the auto-configured one as `<iden>`. Previous iterations on this feature have made sure that well auto-configure at most one `javax.validation.<iden>` so not flagging it `<iden>` is no problem. This commit also restores and adds tests that validate `<file_name>` will configure a JSR validator even if a <iden> is present. This effectively fixes `<issue_link>` in a different way. Closes `<issue_link>` Closes `<issue_link>`

This commit ensures that a primary JSR 303 and `<iden>` will be exposed if the auto-configuration kicks in. As `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts (JSR-303 `<iden>` and `<iden>` as well as the `<iden>` validator one), this makes sure that those types can be injected by type. `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts and were only checking for the absence of a `javax.validation.<iden>` to auto-configure a `<iden>`. If no standard JSR validator exists but a <iden>s `<iden>` exists and is primary, we shouldnt flag the auto-configured one as `<iden>`. Previous iterations on this feature have made sure that well auto-configure at most one `javax.validation.<iden>` so not flagging it `<iden>` is no problem. This commit also restores and adds tests that validate `<file_name>` will configure a JSR validator even if a <iden> is present. This effectively fixes `<issue_link>` in a different way. Rationale2: The health auto-configuration `AutoconfigureOrder` entry was referring to the standard couchbase auto-configuration that was not responsible for configuring the `CouchbaseOperations` bean, causing the health indicator implementation to rely on the presence of such a bean.

Decision1: Fix mapping of <iden>s idle-timeout and heartbeat-interval
Rationale1: Previous to this commit the connection idle timeout and heartbeat interval were mapped to seconds whereas <iden> expects ms for all duration types.
Rationale2: The maximum and minimum number of connections are not metrics so these are not exposed. Fix the doc that stated the contrary.

Decision1: Fix mapping of <iden>s idle-timeout and heartbeat-interval
Rationale1: Previous to this commit the connection idle timeout and heartbeat interval were mapped to seconds whereas <iden> expects ms for all duration types.
Rationale2: simplifying the auto-configuration and let it us proxy-free configuration classes

Decision1: Fix mapping of <iden>s idle-timeout and heartbeat-interval
Rationale1: Previous to this commit the connection idle timeout and heartbeat interval were mapped to seconds whereas <iden> expects ms for all duration types.
Rationale2: This commit ensures that a primary JSR 303 and `<iden>` will be exposed if the auto-configuration kicks in. As `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts (JSR-303 `<iden>` and `<iden>` as well as the `<iden>` validator one), this makes sure that those types can be injected by type. `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts and were only checking for the absence of a `javax.validation.<iden>` to auto-configure a `<iden>`. If no standard JSR validator exists but a <iden>s `<iden>` exists and is primary, we shouldnt flag the auto-configured one as `<iden>`. Previous iterations on this feature have made sure that well auto-configure at most one `javax.validation.<iden>` so not flagging it `<iden>` is no problem. This commit also restores and adds tests that validate `<file_name>` will configure a JSR validator even if a <iden> is present. This effectively fixes `<issue_link>` in a different way. Closes `<issue_link>` Closes `<issue_link>`

Rationale2: Users following the logback documentation can be confused at first so were not logging a warning when we found out that the logback specific property has been specified.

Decision2: Update view of bean types when an override is detected
Rationale2: Previously, when a bean was overridden and its type changes, \<file_name> could be left with a stale view of the beans type. This would lead to incorrect bean condition evaluation as conditions would match or not match based on the beans old type.

Decision1: Fix mapping of <iden>s idle-timeout and heartbeat-interval
Rationale1: Previous to this commit the connection idle timeout and heartbeat interval were mapped to seconds whereas <iden> expects ms for all duration types.
Decision2: Fix <file_name> handling of profiles activated by a file
Rationale2: Previously, <file_name> used a <iden> with no PathTransformer. This would result in an NPE within Maven, compounded by the NPE not being included in the failure message, hindering diagnosis. This commit updates <file_name> to configure its <iden> with a PathTransformer and improves the failure message for better problem diagnosis.

Decision1: Fix encoding of @bean in reference documentation
Rationale2: This commit ensures that a primary JSR 303 and `<iden>` will be exposed if the auto-configuration kicks in. As `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts (JSR-303 `<iden>` and `<iden>` as well as the `<iden>` validator one), this makes sure that those types can be injected by type. `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts and were only checking for the absence of a `javax.validation.<iden>` to auto-configure a `<iden>`. If no standard JSR validator exists but a <iden>s `<iden>` exists and is primary, we shouldnt flag the auto-configured one as `<iden>`. Previous iterations on this feature have made sure that well auto-configure at most one `javax.validation.<iden>` so not flagging it `<iden>` is no problem. This commit also restores and adds tests that validate `<file_name>` will configure a JSR validator even if a <iden> is present. This effectively fixes `<issue_link>` in a different way. Closes `<issue_link>` Closes `<issue_link>`

Rationale2: This commit ensures that a primary JSR 303 and `<iden>` will be exposed if the auto-configuration kicks in. As `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts (JSR-303 `<iden>` and `<iden>` as well as the `<iden>` validator one), this makes sure that those types can be injected by type. `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts and were only checking for the absence of a `javax.validation.<iden>` to auto-configure a `<iden>`. If no standard JSR validator exists but a <iden>s `<iden>` exists and is primary, we shouldnt flag the auto-configured one as `<iden>`. Previous iterations on this feature have made sure that well auto-configure at most one `javax.validation.<iden>` so not flagging it `<iden>` is no problem. This commit also restores and adds tests that validate `<file_name>` will configure a JSR validator even if a <iden> is present. This effectively fixes `<issue_link>` in a different way. Closes `<issue_link>` Closes `<issue_link>`

Rationale2: This commit ensures that a primary JSR 303 and `<iden>` will be exposed if the auto-configuration kicks in. As `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts (JSR-303 `<iden>` and `<iden>` as well as the `<iden>` validator one), this makes sure that those types can be injected by type. `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts and were only checking for the absence of a `javax.validation.<iden>` to auto-configure a `<iden>`. If no standard JSR validator exists but a <iden>s `<iden>` exists and is primary, we shouldnt flag the auto-configured one as `<iden>`. Previous iterations on this feature have made sure that well auto-configure at most one `javax.validation.<iden>` so not flagging it `<iden>` is no problem. This commit also restores and adds tests that validate `<file_name>` will configure a JSR validator even if a <iden> is present. This effectively fixes `<issue_link>` in a different way. Closes `<issue_link>` Closes `<issue_link>`

Rationale1: simplifying the auto-configuration and let it us proxy-free configuration classes
Rationale2: This commit ensures that a primary JSR 303 and `<iden>` will be exposed if the auto-configuration kicks in. As `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts (JSR-303 `<iden>` and `<iden>` as well as the `<iden>` validator one), this makes sure that those types can be injected by type. `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts and were only checking for the absence of a `javax.validation.<iden>` to auto-configure a `<iden>`. If no standard JSR validator exists but a <iden>s `<iden>` exists and is primary, we shouldnt flag the auto-configured one as `<iden>`. Previous iterations on this feature have made sure that well auto-configure at most one `javax.validation.<iden>` so not flagging it `<iden>` is no problem. This commit also restores and adds tests that validate `<file_name>` will configure a JSR validator even if a <iden> is present. This effectively fixes `<issue_link>` in a different way. Closes `<issue_link>` Closes `<issue_link>`

Rationale2: Previously, <file_name> used a <iden> with no PathTransformer. This would result in an NPE within Maven, compounded by the NPE not being included in the failure message, hindering diagnosis. This commit updates <file_name> to configure its <iden> with a PathTransformer and improves the failure message for better problem diagnosis.

Decision2: Update view of bean types when an override is detected

Rationale1: This commit ensures that a primary JSR 303 and `<iden>` will be exposed if the auto-configuration kicks in. As `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts (JSR-303 `<iden>` and `<iden>` as well as the `<iden>` validator one), this makes sure that those types can be injected by type. `<iden>` exposes 3 contracts and were only checking for the absence of a `javax.validation.<iden>` to auto-configure a `<iden>`. If no standard JSR validator exists but a <iden>s `<iden>` exists and is primary, we shouldnt flag the auto-configured one as `<iden>`. Previous iterations on this feature have made sure that well auto-configure at most one `javax.validation.<iden>` so not flagging it `<iden>` is no problem. This commit also restores and adds tests that validate `<file_name>` will configure a JSR validator even if a <iden> is present. This effectively fixes `<issue_link>` in a different way. Rationale1: removes `org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-devtools` (if necessary) when repackaging the application
Decision2: Fix <file_name> handling of profiles activated by a file
Rationale2: Previously, <file_name> used a <iden> with no PathTransformer. This would result in an NPE within Maven, compounded by the NPE not being included in the failure message, hindering diagnosis. This commit updates <file_name> to configure its <iden> with a PathTransformer and improves the failure message for better problem diagnosis.

to fail fast with an information exception message when we detect that the embedded servlet container factory beans class cannot be instantiated

Decision2: Update view of bean types when an override is detected
Rationale2: Previously, when a bean was overridden and its type changes, \<file_name> could be left with a stale view of the beans type. This would lead to incorrect bean condition evaluation as conditions would match or not match based on the beans old type.

Decision2: Fix <file_name> handling of profiles activated by a file
Rationale2: Previously, <file_name> used a <iden> with no PathTransformer. This would result in an NPE within Maven, compounded by the NPE not being included in the failure message, hindering diagnosis. This commit updates <file_name> to configure its <iden> with a PathTransformer and improves the failure message for better problem diagnosis.

Update <file_name> config to look for minor version upgrades
Honour ext and classifier on @Grabbed dependencies
Rationale2: We currently honour type, but ignore ext. <iden> doesnt make a distinction between the two so a Grab that specifies both type and ext but with different values is considered to be an error.
to make it work with `full` Maven profile.
Simplify the exclusion logic used in <iden> by implementing implicit exclusions rather than trying to detect transitive excludes.
specific auto-configuration, allowing <iden> to be used without <file_name> if required

This commit removes the required dependency on `<iden>` instances when creating `<iden>` beans, making it optional.
Only affects the default <iden> (so when users are not overriding the default global user details).

Decision2: Blitz some more special characters from the metric names
Rationale2: When MVC path matchers are used as metric keys, they can still contain invalid characters and patterns (like asterisks). This change removes some more special characters and also tidies up the names a bit so no key part starts or ends with - (which is ugly)

Fix link formatting in custom <iden> section
Fix profile precedence when active and include provided
Rationale2: If profiles were activated via the environment using the active and include profile property, profiles specified via the active property would take precedence. This commit restores that behavior.

Rationale2: Simplify the exclusion logic used in <iden> by implementing implicit exclusions rather than trying to detect transitive excludes.
specific auto-configuration, allowing <iden> to be used without <file_name> if required
This commit removes the required dependency on `<iden>` instances when creating `<iden>` beans, making it optional.

Decision2: Blitz some more special characters from the metric names
Rationale2: When MVC path matchers are used as metric keys, they can still contain invalid characters and patterns (like asterisks). This change removes some more special characters and also tidies up the names a bit so no key part starts or ends with - (which is ugly)

Decision2: Add /error to ignored paths for security autoconfig
Rationale2: Protecting /error doesnt make a great deal of sense and if it is protected you dont get the ErrorPageFilter for the attempt at loading it, so Tomcat renders its own HTML error page

Decision2: Fix broken test (use web app context)
Make file detection more resilient across restarts
Rationale2: Retain file snapshot state across devtools restarts to help prevent detection failures

Decision2: Improve error handling in <iden> upgrade checks
Fix link formatting in custom <iden> section
Remove unnecessary logging by start-docker script
Fix profile precedence when active and include provided
Rationale2: If profiles were activated via the environment using the active and include profile property, profiles specified via the active property would take precedence. This commit restores that behavior.

Decision2: Send Slack Notifications when build completes

Rationale2: It was incorrect to simply replace existing instances because you cant tell from the instance which media types and java types it supports. This fix just prepends the custom converters so they get higher priority.

Decision2: Ensure JPA vendor properties are period separated
Rationale2: This change just makes <file_name> expose a <iden> so the keys are sane
The need to correct the naming from freeMarker to freemarker

Decision2: Remove undefined <iden> appender from basic log4j config <enter> Fixes <issue_link>
Add hooks for failed application context startup
Fix NPE in <file_name> when migration.installedOn is null
Update <file_name>, Replace line break with missing line fold, Closes <pr_link>

Decision1: Test that <iden> works when thread is interrupted
Rationale1: Update RandomAccessDataFile to acquire the semaphore uninterruptibly to allow loading classes or resources on an interrupted thread
Decision2: Update view of bean types when an override is detected
Rationale2: Previously, when a bean was overridden and its type changes, \<file_name> could be left with a stale view of the beans type. This would lead to incorrect bean condition evaluation as conditions would match or not match based on the beans old type.

Decision1: Test that <iden> works when thread is interrupted

Decision2: Fix <file_name> handling of profiles activated by a file
Rationale2: Previously, <file_name> used a <iden> with no PathTransformer. This would result in an NPE within Maven, compounded by the NPE not being included in the failure message, hindering diagnosis. This commit updates <file_name> to configure its <iden> with a PathTransformer and improves the failure message for better problem diagnosis.

Decision2: Disallow all extensions in actuator endpoints (except .json)
Rationale2: Along with the recent change in <iden> to use content-disposition inline (which prevents the download), it also makes sense to limit the extensions allowed by the actuator endpoints. Really there *is* no extension for these endpoints, but since all of them explicitly produce JSON we can add .json for browsers as a convenience in case the app would otherwise choose to send XML. Fixes <issue_link>

Decision2: Fix broken links in the documentation

Decision1: Update view of bean types when an override is detected

Decision2: Honour ext and classifier on @Grabbed dependencies
Rationale2: We currently honour type, but ignore ext. <iden> doesnt make a distinction between the two so a Grab that specifies both type and ext but with different values is considered to be an error.

Decision2: Update <file_name>, Replace line break with missing line fold, Closes <pr_link>

Rationale2: previously, this failure was only logged as a debug message, leaving the user with a misleading message suggesting that the @ConditionalOnBean or <iden> annotation was not configured correctly.

Decision2: Clean up logging dependencies and exclusions
Fix broken links in the documentation
Fix missing trailing / in resource paths

Rationale2: Remove direct reference to spring-data-commons, instead favoring transitive dependency
specific auto-configuration, allowing <iden> to be used without <file_name> if required

Decision2: Disallow all extensions in actuator endpoints (except .json)
Rationale2: Along with the recent change in <iden> to use content-disposition inline (which prevents the download), it also makes sense to limit the extensions allowed by the actuator endpoints. Really there *is* no extension for these endpoints, but since all of them explicitly produce JSON we can add .json for browsers as a convenience in case the app would otherwise choose to send XML. Fixes <issue_link>

Decision2: Add /error to ignored paths for security autoconfig
Rationale2: Protecting /error doesnt make a great deal of sense and if it is protected you dont get the ErrorPageFilter for the attempt at loading it, so Tomcat renders its own HTML error page

Decision2: Fix broken test (use web app context)
Remove unnecessary logging by start-docker script
Send Slack Notifications when build completes
Ensure JPA vendor properties are period separated
Rationale2: This change just makes <file_name> expose a <iden> so the keys are sane

Fix NPE in <file_name> when migration.installedOn is null

Decision1: Fix <file_name> handling of profiles activated by a file
Rationale1: Previously, <file_name> used a <iden> with no PathTransformer. This would result in an NPE within Maven, compounded by the NPE not being included in the failure message, hindering diagnosis. This commit updates <file_name> to configure its <iden> with a PathTransformer and improves the failure message for better problem diagnosis.

This would result in an NPE within Maven, compounded by the NPE not being included in the failure message, hindering diagnosis. This commit updates <file_name> to configure its <iden> with a PathTransformer and improves the failure message for better problem diagnosis.

Decision2: Blitz some more special characters from the metric names
Rationale2: When MVC path matchers are used as metric keys, they can still contain invalid characters and patterns (like asterisks). This change removes some more special characters and also tidies up the names a bit so no key part starts or ends with - (which is ugly)

Decision1: Avoid creating unnecessary garbage during <iden> normalization <enter> Closes <issue_link>
Decision2: Disallow all extensions in actuator endpoints (except .json)
Rationale2: Along with the recent change in <iden> to use content-disposition inline (which prevents the download), it also makes sense to limit the extensions allowed by the actuator endpoints. Really there *is* no extension for these endpoints, but since all of them explicitly produce JSON we can add .json for browsers as a convenience in case the app would otherwise choose to send XML. Fixes <issue_link>

Only affects the default <iden> (so when users are not overriding the default global user details).

Decision2: Disallow all extensions in actuator endpoints (except .json)
Rationale2: Along with the recent change in <iden> to use content-disposition inline (which prevents the download), it also makes sense to limit the extensions allowed by the actuator endpoints. Really there *is* no extension for these endpoints, but since all of them explicitly produce JSON we can add .json for browsers as a convenience in case the app would otherwise choose to send XML. Fixes <issue_link>

Decision2: Blitz some more special characters from the metric names
Rationale2: When MVC path matchers are used as metric keys, they can still contain invalid characters and patterns (like asterisks). This change removes some more special characters and also tidies up the names a bit so no key part starts or ends with - (which is ugly)

Decision2: Blitz some more special characters from the metric names
Rationale2: When MVC path matchers are used as metric keys, they can still contain invalid characters and patterns (like asterisks). This change removes some more special characters and also tidies up the names a bit so no key part starts or ends with - (which is ugly)

Fix profile precedence when active and include provided
Rationale2: If profiles were activated via the environment using the active and include profile property, profiles specified via the active property would take precedence. This commit restores that behavior.

Rationale2: It was incorrect to simply replace existing instances because you cant tell from the instance which media types and java types it supports. This fix just prepends the custom converters so they get higher priority.

Decision2: Disallow all extensions in actuator endpoints (except .json)
Rationale2: Along with the recent change in <iden> to use content-disposition inline (which prevents the download), it also makes sense to limit the extensions allowed by the actuator endpoints. Really there *is* no extension for these endpoints, but since all of them explicitly produce JSON we can add .json for browsers as a convenience in case the app would otherwise choose to send XML. Fixes <issue_link>

Rationale2: Protecting /error doesnt make a great deal of sense and if it is protected you dont get the ErrorPageFilter for the attempt at loading it, so Tomcat renders its own HTML error page

Rationale2: Along with the recent change in <iden> to use content-disposition inline (which prevents the download), it also makes sense to limit the extensions allowed by the actuator endpoints. Really there *is* no extension for these endpoints, but since all of them explicitly produce JSON we can add .json for browsers as a convenience in case the app would otherwise choose to send XML. Fixes <issue_link>

Decision2: Ensure JPA vendor properties are period separated
Rationale2: This change just makes <file_name> expose a <iden> so the keys are sane

Decision1: Blitz some more special characters from the metric names
Rationale1: When MVC path matchers are used as metric keys, they can still contain invalid characters and patterns (like asterisks). This change removes some more special characters and also tidies up the names a bit so no key part starts or ends with - (which is ugly)

Rationale1: Protecting /error doesnt make a great deal of sense and if it is protected you dont get the ErrorPageFilter for the attempt at loading it, so Tomcat renders its own HTML error page
Decision2: Fix profile precedence when active and include provided
Rationale2: If profiles were activated via the environment using the active and include profile property, profiles specified via the active property would take precedence. This commit restores that behavior.
